business.headline: Court restrains media from publishing defamatory content against Adani EnterpriseAEL alleged that coordinated defamatory publications on paranjoy.in, adaniwatch.org and adanifiles.com.au, along with related videos and posts, were deliberately designed to tarnish its reputation and disrupt its global business operations.

PhysicsWallah files for Rs 3,820 crore IPO amid edtech sector slowdownEdtech unicorn PhysicsWallah has filed for a ₹38.2 billion ($437M) IPO, aiming to expand physical centers, tech, and acquisitions. The move comes as India's IPO market gains momentum after a slow start.

Terrific effort but still away from being Good and Simple Tax: Ex-CEA on GST 2.0Former Chief Economic Advisor Arvind Subramanian analyses the recent GST rationalisation. He states the tax has become "more good and more simple" with the removal of the 28% slab, but cautions, "we're still some ways away from reaching that goal."

Gold prices surge by Rs 900 to Rs 1.07 lakh amid interest rate cut hopesGold of 99.5 per cent purity advanced by Rs 900 to Rs 1,06,100 per 10 grams (inclusive of all taxes) on Friday, from the previous close of Rs 1,05,200 per 10 grams.

India's forex reserves rise by $3.5 billion to $694 billion, says RBIFor the week ended August 29, foreign currency assets, a major component of the reserves, increased by USD 1.686 billion to USD 583.937 billion.
Urban Company and 2 IPOs lined for next week. Check GMP and detailsUrban Company, Dev Accelerator and Shringar House of Mangalsutra will all launch their IPOs on September 10, 2025.

The truth behind "Guaranteed 8–10% Returns": Expert explains the realityMany savers in India are often attracted to insurance plans that promise "guaranteed" returns, offering the appeal of steady growth without exposure to market risks. But do these policies actually deliver what they claim?

Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 2.0, citizen relief, and way forwardIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman talked about the next-generation GST reforms, GST classification, how the GST reforms benefits will be passed on to common man, the opposition's 'Gabbar Singh Tax' jibe on GST and much more.

Finance Minister on GST Slabs, Medicine Taxes, and US-India Tariff WarFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, during an exclusive interview with India Today TV, addressed public's queries from Lucknow on key economic issues, including GST slabs and international trade tariffs.

Nirmala Sitharaman answers questions on GST reforms from KolkataFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, during an exclusive interview with India Today TV, addressed questions of public from Kolkata regarding recent GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as auto sector stocks offset losses by IT sharesThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by just 7.25 points to close at 80,710.76, while the NSE Nifty50 gained a paltry 6.70 points to end at 24,741.00.

Exclusive: Why GST started with 4 slabs? Nirmala Sitharaman explainsWhen GST was launched in 2017, it came with four slabs, 5%, 12%, 18% and 28%. With GST 2.0 now moving to a simpler two-slab system, Nirmala Sitharaman has explained why the original multi-slab structure was necessary.

Exclusive: Will common man get insurance rate cut benefits in GST 2.0? FM answersFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman made it clear that the tax relief was introduced for citizens and not for insurance companies.

Popcorn puzzle solved: Nirmala Sitharaman explains GST classificationIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman explained why salted and chocolate-coated variants had earlier attracted different GST rates.

Why petrol, diesel is still not part of GST? Nirmala Sitharaman answersThe new GST 2.0 promises a simpler, two-rate structure and relief for many sectors. But fuel, petrol and diesel, remains outside its ambit. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has explained the reason behind this decision.

What's next after GST 2.0? Nirmala Sitharaman on GST 3.0 plansFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has confirmed that GST 2.0, with its new two-slab framework, will begin on September 22. But the bigger question is, what lies ahead in GST 3.0?

Benz vs Hawai chappal: Nirmala Sitharaman on why India isn't ready for uniform GSTIn an exclusive conversation with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman stated that while "one nation, one tax" remains an aspirational idea, India's uneven levels of development make a uniform GST rate unfair.

Exclusive: How will government ensure GST cut benefits pass on to consumers? FM explainsFinance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman addressed concerns about rate-cut benefits being passed on to people, explaining how the government plans to track the benefits in an exclusive with India Today.

GST rate cuts must be passed on to public, that's the focus: Nirmala SitharamanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said GST 2.0's success hinges on strict vigilance to ensure rate cuts are fully passed on to consumers.

GST rate cut, portfolio reset: Where should your money go now?The Goods and Services Tax (GST) is moving away from the four-slab system of 5%, 12%, 18% and 28% to a simpler structure of just two main rates, 5% and 18%.

Life and health insurance premiums exempt from GST: How much will you save?With full GST exemption, life and health insurance premiums could become lower, potentially saving policyholders several thousand rupees. The change is expected to cover all individual policies, including term plans, ULIPs, endowments, and senior citizen health plans.

Buying a home vs investing in stocks: Which builds more wealth, explains expertIndians often believe owning a house is the ultimate financial goal. But when it comes to wealth creation, stocks may have left property behind. An expert breaks down the real returns.

Explained: Why stock markets are down despite GST 2.0 reformsThe BSE Sensex slipped 254.91 points to 80,463.10, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 69.25 points to 24,665.05 at 12:08 pm. Both benchmarks had gained in early trade.

Government may announce schemes to help exporters hit by Trump tariffs: SourcesWith textiles, gems, and leather shipments now weighed down by a 50% duty, the government is drawing up a relief package aimed at keeping liquidity flowing and jobs intact.

ITR filing after September 15? Here's the penalty and conditions you must checkThe extended deadline to file income tax returns (ITR) for FY 2024–25 is September 15, 2025. Missing it means your return will be treated as belated, attracting penalties and interest. Here's what you need to know.

GST 2.0: Diwali gift for the middle class, but what about businesses?The GST rate cut boost to consumer sentiment is expected to drive demand, but industry experts say that the reforms also carry long-term benefits for businesses.
GST 2.0: Essentials cheaper, but these items will now cost moreWhile essentials will see meaningful relief, everyday indulgences and luxury items will carry heavier taxes.

GST cuts drive auto sector rally: Top stocks to keep on your radarWith the festive season approaching, experts believe that automobile companies will be among the biggest winners of the recent rate cuts in GST.

Sensex, Nifty extend gains as GST cut optimism fuels Dalal Street rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex gained nearly 300 points in early trade, while the Nifty50 climbed past 24,800, signalling the possibility of a fresh rally if a favourable outcome emerges on the US tariff front.

Oracle, Salesforce cut hundreds of jobs in US as tech layoffs drag on: ReportIn filings with state regulators, the two software giants disclosed plans to eliminate more than 500 jobs in the Bay Area and nearly 200 in the Seattle region. Salesforce is cutting 262 roles in San Francisco, while Oracle is eliminating 254 jobs spread across Redwood City, Pleasanton and Santa Clara.

How much will you invest in US? Trump presses tech titans at White House dinnerAt a White House dinner with top tech CEOs, Donald Trump pressed Apple, Google, Meta, and Microsoft on their US investments.

What after Armani: The way ahead for iconic Italian fashion empireGiorgio Armani, who died at 91 leaving no children, built one of the world's most iconic fashion brands and ensured its future independence through a foundation.

US scraps Biden-era plan mandating airlines to pay for flight disruptionsIn December, the US Department of Transportation under then-President Joe Biden sought public comment on the rulemaking process about whether airlines should be required to pay $200 to $300 for domestic delays of at least three hours and up to $775 for longer delays.

GST reforms: Will consumption and investment get a real boost? Experts debateA major overhaul of the Goods and Services Tax, termed GST 2.0, has been initiated, which the government is calling a significant 'Diwali bonus' for consumers and the economy.

GST 2.0 is game-changing and transformational reform: Piyush GoyalIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Managing Editor Marya Shakil, Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal called GST 2.0 the most game-changing and transformational reform the country has seen in several decades.

GST 2.0 a game-changing reform for citizens and businesses: Piyush GoyalUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal has described the new GST 2.0 reforms as a "game-changing" move that will simplify taxes, reduce prices on daily essentials, and give a major boost to India's economy.

Zara, Lacoste, and other global brands face higher GST: ReportInternational names such as Zara, H&M, Levi's, Lacoste, Nike and Uniqlo could be directly impacted. These brands rely heavily on India's growing middle-class youth, who see branded apparel as a lifestyle upgrade but remain highly price-sensitive.

GST reforms commendable, will have far-reaching benefits: Anand SharmaIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV, former Commerce Minister Anand Sharma provides his assessment of the next-generation GST reforms.

Sensex, Nifty end higher: Is GST 2.0 next big trigger for the economy?Speaking on the possible impact on the market closing show on BT TV, Vinit Bolinjkar, Head of Research at Ventura Securities, said the domestic economy is set for a strong rebound.

What are 'sin' goods? All you need to know about special 40% GST slabFrom September 22, 2025, India will have a simpler GST system with just two main rates and a special 40% slab. This top rate applies only to a few products, popularly known as 'sin goods'. Let's break it down.

entertainment.headline: Demon Slayer Infinity Castle set for historic 5 am shows in IndiaThe highly-anticipated anime film 'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' is set to release globally on September 12, including early morning screenings in Mumbai, marking a first for Japanese cinema in India.

Trisha cheers for Thalapathy Vijay, wishes him success in his next chapterAt the 2025 SIIMA awards in Dubai, Trisha Krishnan was honoured for her 25-year journey in South Indian cinema and warmly wished co-star Vijay success in his new ventures. She also praised Ajith Kumar's humility and kindness.

My love, you complete me: Shahid Kapoor's emotional birthday note for wife Mira RajputMira Rajput Kapoor turned 31 on Sunday, September 7. On the occasion, her actor-husband Shahid Kapoor had the sweetest birthday note.

Not just acting, Aamir Khan serenades fans with his singing skills. WatchAamir Khan has caught everyone's attention with his singing skills in a viral video, showcasing a new side of the star. A video from a recent event has now gone viral.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan in tears as Kunickaa's son Ayaan narrates her life storyThe latest 'Weekend Ka Vaar' episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' touched hearts as Kunickaa Sadanand's son, Ayaan Lal, stood up for his mother against hurtful remarks, revealing her struggles and resilience. Salman Khan and the audience were visibly moved by this emotional moment.

SIIMA 2025 Tamil, Malayalam: Prithviraj Sukumaran, Sai Pallavi win top honoursSIIMA 2025 honours Tamil and Malayalam cinema: Sivakarthikeyan's 'Amaran' and Prithviraj Sukumaran's 'The Goat Life' take top honours. Sai Pallavi won Best Actor (Female) and Sukumaran bagged Best Actor.

India's Anuparna Roy makes history, wins Best Director at 82nd Venice Film FestivalThe 82nd Venice Film Festival concluded with Indian filmmaker Anuparna Roy making history, winning Best Director for her debut 'Songs of Forgotten Trees', while American indie 'Father Mother Sister Brother' took home the Golden Lion for Best Film.

Akshay Kumar leads beach clean-up drive in Mumbai, champions public responsibilityAkshay Kumar actively participated in a beach clean-up drive at Mumbai's Juhu Beach, joining hands with Amruta Fadnavis and BMC officials to promote environmental responsibility.

Baaghi 4 vs Bengal Files box office Day 2: Tiger Shroff's action hits high gearThe box office clash between 'Baaghi 4' and 'The Bengal Files' reflects audiences' stronger pull towards action, as the Tiger Shroff-starrer leads while the political drama gains attention for its historical narrative.

Arijit Singh stuns London crowd with surprise Saiyaara renditionArijit Singh mesmerised fans at London's Tottenham Hotspur Stadium with a soulful and retro-infused performance of 'Saiyaara'. The unexpected choice of this hit track had the entire stadium singing along.

Kareena Kapoor slays in silver at Birmingham event, fans flock in a flurryBollywood icon Kareena Kapoor Khan created a buzz in Birmingham as she dazzled fans at a store launch, charming the crowd with her elegance and warmth. Several videos and pictures from the event went viral on social media.

Comedian Zakir Khan announces break, says been unwell for a yearStand-up comedian Zakir Khan has decided to take a break from his touring schedule to prioritise his health after a decade of rigorous performances across India. He will continue with a limited 'Papa Yaar India' tour starting October 2025, followed by a much-needed long break.

Rakesh Roshan turns 76: Ameesha, Simi Garewal extend wishes with throwback picsActor Ameesha Patel wished her mentor Rakesh Roshan on his 76th birthday. She called him a 'beacon of hope' by sharing a throwback photo. His actor-friend Simi Garewal also wrote a sweet birthday note for him.

Chandra gave me goosebumps: Samantha cheers for Kalyani Priyadarshan's Lokah'Lokah: Chapter 1', featuring Kalyani Priyadarshan as India's first female superhero, has garnered widespread acclaim for its captivating blend of mythology and fantasy. Recently, Samantha joined the list of celebs who hailed the movie.

Bigg Boss 19: Salman Khan scolds Amaal Malik, asks if he only came to sleepBigg Boss 19 host Salman Khan scolded singer Amaal Malik for not living up to the audience's expectations as a contestant on the reality show. Salman asked Amaal whether he wanted to make a difference or not.

Amol Parashar responds to relationship buzz with Konkona: People made it officialAmol Parashar addressed rumours about his relationship with Konkona Sensharma, clarifying their public appearance was just a casual event with friends and family.

SIIMA 2025 full winners list: Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna win bigThe South Indian International Movie Awards 2025 celebrated outstanding achievements in South Indian cinema, with 'Kalki 2898 AD' winning Best Film and multiple honours for 'Pushpa 2: The Rule'.

Director Vikram Bhatt's mother dies at 85 after prolonged illness. ReportDirector-producer Vikram Bhatt's mother Varsha Bhatt died at 85 after a prolonged illness, according to reports. The family is yet to release an official statement.

Bigg Boss 19: Tanya Mittal's family reacts to criticism, requests people to be kind'Bigg Boss 19' contestant Tanya Mittal is currently at the centre of social media debates. Her parents have now appealed for fairness and asked viewers to reserve judgment until the show ends.

general news.headline: 1 dead, 19 injured in fire at Mumbai's 23-storey buildingAccording to the Fire Department, a preliminary investigation found that the fire originated in the basement due to a malfunctioning electric wire and then spread upward through the electric duct.

Hockey Asia Cup final Live: India lead 2-0 after Sukhjeet and Dilpreet's goalsIndia vs Korea, Hockey Asia Cup final Live updates: India are 2-0 ahead in the Hockey Asia Cup final against Korea, courtesy to goals from Sukhjeet and Dilpreet. However, Korea have the capacity to aim for a comeback in the second half.

20-year-old gang-raped by acquaintances during birthday celebration in KolkataA 20-year-old woman from Haridevpur has accused two acquaintances of gang-raping her during her birthday celebration in Kolkata's Regent's Park area. The suspects are at large, while police have registered a case and launched an investigation.

Show courage, slap 75% tariffs on US goods: Arvind Kejriwal's dare to PMArvind Kejriwal also criticised the Narendra Modi government's decision to exempt an 11 per cent duty on US cotton imports until December 31, 2025, warning that such a move would disadvantage local farmers while enriching American agriculturists.

Lucky with H-1B, unlucky with TrumpOnce the ultimate ticket to the American Dream, the H-1B visa stands vilified now. As the Trump administration cracks down, Indians with H-1B and jobs are scared to go to the US.

When unpredictability meets intensity: US Open set for SinCaraz finalJannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz are meeting for the 3rd time in a Grand Slam final. Whoever wins the match will be crowned No.1 in the world.

Ex-MP Prajwal Revanna to work as library clerk inside jail for Rs 522 daily wageFormer JD(S) MP Prajwal Revanna's main responsibilities include issuing books to other inmates and maintaining records of borrowed books, according to jail authorities.

Comeback kid Congress? Will Bihar walk Rahul Gandhi's Voter Adhikar talk?The Voter Adhikar Yatra, with Tejashwi Yadav and other INDIA leaders, may have just given the Congress what it lacked in the Bihar poll theatre: visibility and legitimacy

MS Dhoni in an action flick? Thala goes guns blazing with R Madhavan in new teaserMS Dhoni has stunned fans with a high-octane action teaser alongside R Madhavan in Vasan Bala's The Chase. The cricket legend turned task-force officer has left the internet buzzing over his unexpected on-screen avatar.

India lobbyist Jason Miller meets 'President in-action' Trump amid tariff rowMiller, who leads SHW Partners LLC, was engaged by the Indian mission in Washington earlier this year under a reported one-year agreement worth USD 1.8 million.

In rare gesture, PM Modi sits in last row at BJP MPs' workshop for Veep pollPrime Minister Narendra Modi attended the BJP MPs' workshop at the GMC Balayogi Auditorium, choosing to sit in the last row among parliamentarians.

Max Verstappen wins Italian GP, breaks Michael Schumacher's fastest race time recordMax Verstappen claimed a record-breaking win at the Italian Grand Prix, shattering Michael Schumacher's fastest race time. The Red Bull driver dominated at Monza, while Lando Norris salvaged second for McLaren after late pit stop drama.

Teen coder, known as God's influencer, becomes first millennial Catholic saintCarlo Acutis was a British-born Italian boy and was born in 1991. He died of Leukaemia (blood cancer) in October 2006 at the age of 15. He used computer coding to spread the Catholic faith around the world.

Japan PM Shigeru Ishiba steps down, bows to pressure after poll setbacksJapanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba on Sunday announced he would step down, ending months of political turmoil within the ruling Liberal Democratic Party (LDP).

Planned an Islamic India by 2047: Chargesheet in Chhangur religious conversion caseThe ATS cracked down on Chhangur Baba, who allegedly received Rs 500 crore from Muslim countries to operate a conversion racket that systematically targeted poor, widowed, and vulnerable women.

Israeli airport damaged in Houthi drone strike, causing temporary airspace closureThe IDF claimed to have intercepted three Unmanned Aerial Vehicles (UAVs), saying two of them were shot down before they could cross into Israeli territory.

Total lunar eclipse tonight: Moon to turn blood-red for 82 minutesThis striking phenomenon, often referred to as a "Blood Moon", will last for an impressive 82 minutes, making it one of the longest total lunar eclipses of the decade.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Will call you back: Himanta Sarma grants boy's wish to visit chief minister's houseThe Assam chief minister's gesture is winning hearts as social media users have heaped a lot of praise on him for his approachable demeanour.

When Bengal assembly turned Ground Zero of Mamata-BJP warThe Trinamool-BJP battle in the run-up to the Bengal assembly polls is taking the shape of a bitter face-off over Bangla identity, history and the very right to speak the language

Hyundai cars get cheaper after GST cut, Creta sees benefits up to Rs 72,145Hyundai has announced price cuts of up to Rs 2.4 lakh across its lineup, passing on the full benefit of the recent GST 2.0 reforms effective September 22, 2025.

X fact checks Peter Navarro's India rants, he rants even morePeter Navarro, the White House trade adviser, who has for days targeted New Delhi over its energy purchases from Moscow, alleged that India was buying Russian oil "purely to profit" and to feed the Russian "war machine" in Ukraine.

Case against NCP Leader who called Ajit Pawar during standoff with woman officerThe police case comes after a video showed Ajit Pawar rebuking IPS officer Anjana Krishna on phone after local party leader and workers obsctructed officials' work in Solapur.

Ukrainian woman seeking safety in US stabbed to death by ex-conman in trainA 23-year-old Ukrainian refugee, Iryna Zarutska, was fatally stabbed on a Charlotte light rail train in a random attack by homeless ex-convict Decarlos Brown Jr. The incident has raised concerns over transit safety in the city.

sports.headline: Kylian Mbappe picks Ousmane Dembele as clear Ballon d'Or 2025 favouriteKylian Mbappe has backed Ousmane Dembele for the 2025 Ballon d'Or, praising his treble-winning season with PSG, while Barcelona's Lamine Yamal and Raphinha also remain strong contenders in one of football's most competitive races.

Hockey Asia Cup final Live: India lead 2-0 at half-timeIndia vs Korea, Hockey Asia Cup final Live updates: India are 2-0 ahead in the Hockey Asia Cup final against Korea, courtesy to goals from Sukhjeet and Dilpreet. However, Korea have the capacity to aim for a comeback in the second half.

Duleep Trophy: Jagadeesan helps South Zone, Central Zone advance despite Jaiswal fiftySouth Zone and Central Zone secured final spots in Duleep Trophy 2025 after first-innings leads. Both teams face player shortages due to India A commitments, adding uncertainty to the final.

South Africa's Prenelan Subrayen cleared to bowl by ICC after suspect action reviewThe ICC has cleared South Africa's spinner Prenelan Subrayen to continue bowling in international cricket. This comes alongside South Africa's third ODI game against England.

Watch: Marnus Labuschagne's hat-trick guides Redlands to T20 Max triumphMarnus Labuschagne took a hat-trick to help Redlands win the KFC T20 Max Final against Valleys. He registered bowling figures of 3/13 in 2.2 overs and secured a 41-run victory for his team in the final.

Agarkar's selection committee have done a fantastic job: Ex-India playerThe Indian cricket team has seen a fair bit of success in white ball cricket in the recent past. Former cricketer Devang Gandhi has credited that success to brave calls from Ajit Agarkar.

MS Dhoni in an action flick? Thala goes guns blazing with R Madhavan in new teaserMS Dhoni has stunned fans with a high-octane action teaser alongside R Madhavan in Vasan Bala's The Chase. The cricket legend turned task-force officer has left the internet buzzing over his unexpected on-screen avatar.

Pant used to ask bowlers to attack his body at fast pace: Former India coachFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar revealed Rishabh Pant's fearless approach from early days. Pant's has been undergoing rehabilitation after fracturing his toe during the England Test series.

Historic gold for India's men's compound archery team at World ChampionshipsThe Indian men's compound archery team won their first-ever gold at the World Archery Championships. This historic victory highlights India's rising prowess in compound archery and boosts medal hopes for the tournament.

Agarkar's selection committee have done a fantastic job: Ex-India playerThe Indian cricket team has seen a fair bit of success in white ball cricket in the recent past. Former cricketer Devang Gandhi has credited that success to brave calls from Ajit Agarkar.

MS Dhoni in an action flick? Thala goes guns blazing with R Madhavan in new teaserMS Dhoni has stunned fans with a high-octane action teaser alongside R Madhavan in Vasan Bala's The Chase. The cricket legend turned task-force officer has left the internet buzzing over his unexpected on-screen avatar.

Pant used to ask bowlers to attack his body at fast pace: Former India coachFormer India batting coach Sanjay Bangar revealed Rishabh Pant's fearless approach from early days. Pant's has been undergoing rehabilitation after fracturing his toe during the England Test series.

Historic gold for India's men's compound archery team at World ChampionshipsThe Indian men's compound archery team won their first-ever gold at the World Archery Championships. This historic victory highlights India's rising prowess in compound archery and boosts medal hopes for the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
